name: UIActivity
desc: An abstract class that you subclass to implement app-specific services.

items.name: class var activityCategory: UIActivity.Category
items.desc: The category of the activity, which may be used to group activities in the UI.

items.name: enum UIActivity.Category
items.desc: An enumeration that defines categories of activities.

items.name: var activityType: UIActivity.ActivityType?
items.desc: The type of service being provided.

items.name: struct UIActivity.ActivityType
items.desc: A structure that describes the types of acitivities for which the system has built-in support.

items.name: var activityTitle: String?
items.desc: A user-readable string that describes the service.

items.name: var activityImage: UIImage?
items.desc: An image that identifies the service to the user.

items.name: func canPerform(withActivityItems: [Any]) -> Bool
items.desc: Queries whether the service can act on the specified data items.

items.name: func prepare(withActivityItems: [Any])
items.desc: Prepares your service to act on the specified data.

items.name: var activityViewController: UIViewController?
items.desc: The view controller to present to the user.

items.name: func perform()
items.desc: Performs the service when no custom view controller is provided.

items.name: func activityDidFinish(Bool)
items.desc: Notifies the system that your activity object has completed its work.
